channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Intensifies Strikes in Lebanon Amid Push for Cease-Fire
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has deepened in recent days despite diplomatic efforts to move toward a temporary truce.

item.title: Bernie Sanders Is Wrong That Democrats Abandoned the Working Class
item.description: The party’s record is clear and strong.

item.title: Roy Haynes, a Giant of Jazz Drumming, Is Dead at 99
item.description: An irrepressible force who remained relevant over the course of a seven-decade career, he had a hand in every major development in modern jazz.

item.title: Tom Brady’s key to success: ‘To me, failure is amazing’
item.description: Hard lessons as a benchwarmer and sixth-round draft pick fuelled the career of a 7-time Super Bowl winner.

item.title: Why Trump’s Victory Is Fueling a Market Frenzy
item.description: Investors have been comforted by a clear election result and are anticipating tax cuts and deregulation from a second Trump administration.

item.title: Hanako Okada Beat the Odds to Upend a Male Political Dynasty in Japan
item.description: Hanako Okada was one of 73 women to win seats at the general election last month, a record number in a Parliament long dominated by men.

item.title: Volkswagen and Rivian Form Joint Venture, Deepening Alliance
item.description: The new agreement builds on an earlier announcement in which the German automaker said it would invest up to $5 billion in Rivian, a maker of electric...

item.title: A Former Harrods Employee Accuses Al-Fayed of Trafficking and Says His Brother Knew
item.description: In a U.S. court filing, a former employee says she was trafficked, raped and abused when Mohamed al-Fayed owned Harrods, and that his brother Ali may ...

item.title: DEI efforts are critical to the U.S. economy because ‘there’s not enough white men,’ John Hope Bryant says
item.description: The U.S. can’t remain the leading global economy if it doesn’t let its citizens become financially stable.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Trade Deadly Attacks
item.description: Israeli strikes pounded areas in the southern suburbs of Beirut, a day after eight people were killed, according to the authorities, in the northernmo...

item.title: As Congress Returns, Trump Casts a Long Shadow Over Capitol Hill
item.description: The president-elect is to visit Capitol Hill on Wednesday as Republican senators elect a majority leader. His staffing decisions are already depleting...

item.title: Joshua Kushner: Why I bet $1.3 billion on OpenAI
item.description: Joshua Kushner said at Fortune’s Global Forum there were two main reasons.

item.title: Glassdoor CEO talks about the hottest jobs in the AI boom—and the one job he thinks is phasing out
item.description: Data scientists and engineers are in, copy writing is out.

item.title: The UK’s Award-Winning Centenary Building May be Reduced to Rubble
item.description: A building, once celebrated for its innovation, is deemed obsolete. Those trying to save it ask what its demolition means for British architecture.

item.title: AARP’s new CEO vows to protect Social Security, Medicare, and ensure older adults age ‘on their own terms’
item.description: Her top priorities also include pushing for financial support for caregivers.
